description: The CodeBoarding tool operates as a sophisticated pipeline, orchestrating the analysis of codebases from initial retrieval through static analysis, AI-driven interpretation, and optimized processing. The Orchestration & Output Engine initiates and manages the entire workflow, delegating tasks to the Static Analysis Engine for deep code introspection. The AI Interpretation Layer then leverages these analysis results, accessing specific codebase details via the AI Tooling & Data Access Layer, to generate high-level insights. Throughout this process, the Analysis Optimization & Caching component ensures efficiency by detecting changes and managing cached data, while the Monitoring & Observability component tracks system health and performance metrics, providing a comprehensive overview of the analysis lifecycle.

components.name: Orchestration & Output Engine
components.description: This component serves as the central control unit, managing the entire codebase analysis workflow. It orchestrates job execution, interacts with the repository for code retrieval, and is responsible for generating various documentation outputs such as HTML, Markdown, and RST based on the analysis results. It acts as the glue connecting all other components.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: The central control unit responsible for parsing CLI arguments, coordinating the entire analysis workflow, triggering diagram generation, and setting up monitoring. It acts as the primary orchestrator, connecting all other components to execute a codebase analysis job and managing its lifecycle.

components.name: CLI Entry Point & Argument Parser
components.description: This component serves as the application's initial point of contact, responsible for interpreting user commands and configurations provided via the command line. It validates the input and prepares the necessary parameters for the subsequent workflow.

components.name: Environment & Health Checker
components.description: Performs diagnostic checks on the system environment before an analysis job commences, verifying the presence and correct configuration of dependencies. It ensures the tool operates in a healthy and compatible environment, reporting any critical issues.

components.name: Workflow Orchestrator
components.description: The core coordination unit of the Orchestration Engine. It takes the parsed arguments and orchestrates the entire analysis pipeline, deciding whether to process a local or remote repository and delegating tasks to other specialized components. It manages the overall flow and lifecycle of an analysis job.

components.name: Run Context & Monitoring Manager
components.description: Responsible for establishing and managing the operational context for each analysis run. It generates unique identifiers, creates dedicated directories for logs, monitoring data, and output files, and initializes the monitoring infrastructure for the job.

components.name: API Gateway
components.description: Provides the RESTful interface for external clients to create, monitor, and retrieve documentation jobs. It serves as the primary entry point for API-driven interactions, receiving job requests and forwarding them for processing.

components.name: Job Management Service
components.description: This component is the public-facing interface of the API Gateway, responsible for receiving and validating all external requests related to job creation, status monitoring, and listing. It orchestrates the initial steps of job processing based on incoming API calls.

components.name: Job Processing & Generation Service
components.description: This component manages the internal workflow for executing documentation or onboarding generation tasks. It handles the setup and teardown of temporary resources and orchestrates the invocation of the core logic required to produce the final documentation output.

components.name: Configuration Service
components.description: Provides a centralized mechanism for accessing and managing application-wide configuration settings. This includes critical parameters such as database connection strings and paths for temporary file storage, ensuring consistent operational behavior across the API Gateway's internal components.

components.name: Job Management Service
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of analysis jobs, including creation, status updates, and retrieval, using DuckDB for persistence. It ensures that job progress and results are tracked and accessible throughout the analysis workflow, responding to requests from the API Gateway and providing status to the Orchestration Engine.

components.name: Job Orchestrator
components.description: Primary controller for the job lifecycle. Initiates documentation generation jobs, manages execution flow, monitors progress, updates status, and provides interfaces for external systems to query job status and retrieve details.

components.name: Job Data Access Layer
components.description: Persistence layer for all job-related metadata. Encapsulates DuckDB interactions, handling connection management, schema initialization, and CRUD operations for job records.

components.name: Temporary Environment Manager
components.description: Utility component responsible for managing transient filesystem resources required during job execution. Creates isolated temporary directories for cloning and processing repository data and ensures cleanup after job completion.

components.name: Application Configuration
components.description: Centralizes management and retrieval of application-wide configuration settings, providing a consistent interface for accessing parameters such as default values, system paths, and other operational settings used across the Job Management Service.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Abstracts all interactions with the code repository, including cloning, checking out specific versions, and applying ignore rules. It provides a clean interface for the Orchestration Engine and Analysis Core to securely access codebase files and manage repository-related errors.

components.name: CLI/Orchestration Engine
components.description: The primary entry point of the application, responsible for parsing command-line arguments, validating environment variables, and orchestrating the entire analysis workflow. It initiates repository handling, sets up monitoring, applies ignore rules, and triggers the core diagram generation process.

components.name: Diagram Generation & AI Interpretation Engine
components.description: Performs the core static analysis of the codebase, interacts with various LLM agents for abstraction, detail extraction, and meta-analysis. It processes individual code components and ultimately produces architectural diagrams and comprehensive analysis results.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Manages all interactions with the code repository, including cloning, checking out specific versions, and extracting repository metadata. It provides a secure and abstracted interface for other components to access codebase files.

components.name: File Filtering & Ignore Manager
components.description: Applies various ignore rules (e.g., .gitignore, .codeboardingignore) to filter out irrelevant files and directories from the codebase. This optimizes the scope of analysis by focusing only on pertinent source code.

components.name: Monitoring & Run Management
components.description: Responsible for creating and managing run-specific directories and unique identifiers for each analysis execution. It organizes outputs, logs, and tracks metadata across multiple analysis runs.

components.name: Repository Error Handling
components.description: Defines and manages custom error classes specifically for repository-related issues (e.g., missing GitHub tokens, non-existent repositories). It provides a standardized error-handling contract for the Repository Manager.

components.name: Analysis Core
components.description: Performs static analysis and leverages LLMs for code abstraction, ultimately producing structured analysis data and diagrams. It's responsible for the core intelligence of the tool, transforming raw code into meaningful insights and requesting code content from the Repository Manager.

components.name: Analysis Core
components.description: Performs static analysis and leverages LLMs for code abstraction, ultimately producing structured analysis data and diagrams. It's responsible for the core intelligence of the tool, transforming raw code into meaningful insights and requesting code content from the Repository Manager.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: External component responsible for providing the raw source code files to the Analysis Core subsystem. It handles fetching and managing code repositories.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Performs deep static analysis of the codebase, parsing source files, constructing ASTs, conducting CFG analysis, and extracting structural information like class hierarchies, function definitions, and module dependencies.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: Uses large language models to abstract, summarize, and interpret the detailed output from the Static Analysis Engine, identifying high-level architectural patterns, component responsibilities, and interaction flows.

components.name: Structured Data Emitter
components.description: Formats the abstract insights generated by the AI Interpretation Layer into a standardized, queryable structured data model, ensuring consistent representation for downstream consumption.

components.name: Diagram Generation Engine
components.description: Renders visual architectural diagrams (e.g., component diagrams, sequence diagrams) from the structured analysis data using tools like Mermaid.js.

components.name: Output Renderer
components.description: Converts the structured analysis results into various documentation formats such as HTML, Markdown, MDX, reStructuredText, and interactive diagrams. It's responsible for the final presentation layer of the analysis, utilizing templating utilities for effective rendering.

components.name: output_generators
components.description: Orchestrates the output generation process by receiving structured analysis results and dispatching them to appropriate format‑specific rendering sub‑components. Manages the workflow of converting raw analysis data into polished documentation.

components.name: output_generators.html_template
components.description: Handles HTML templating and rendering of structured analysis data into HTML format, populating templates with dynamic content to produce well‑structured and visually appealing HTML output.

components_relations.relation: receives structured analysis results from external components

components.name: CI/CD Adapter
components.description: Provides an integration layer specifically designed for CI/CD environments (e.g., GitHub Actions). It orchestrates full analysis runs within automated pipelines, allowing the tool to be seamlessly incorporated into development workflows.

components.name: GitHub Actions Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central control point for running the codebase analysis tool within GitHub Actions CI/CD pipelines. It parses CI/CD specific inputs, configures the execution environment, and orchestrates the documentation generation workflow, dispatching calls to various output formatters.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Responsible for deep code introspection, this component parses source files, builds internal representations like Control Flow Graphs (CFGs) and Call Graphs, and extracts structural information across multiple programming languages. It utilizes Language Server Protocol (LSP) clients for detailed analysis and provides the raw data for subsequent AI interpretation.

components.name: Static Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Manages the overall static analysis workflow, initiating project scanning, coordinating language-specific LSP clients, and aggregating analysis results. It acts as the central control unit, orchestrating the pipeline and ensuring each sub‑component runs in the correct order.

components.name: StaticAnalyzer
components.description: Orchestrates the core static analysis workflow, parsing source files, building internal representations, extracting structural and semantic information, converting raw data into a structured format, and supporting incremental analysis using change context.

components.name: GitDiffAnalyzer
components.description: Handles interactions with Git to detect code changes, identify changed and uncommitted files, retrieve commit information, and provide change‑detection data to other components for efficient incremental analysis.

components.name: LSP Communication Layer
components.description: Provides the generic interface for Language Server Protocol (LSP) servers, handling low‑level LSP communication, sending requests, processing responses, and managing language‑specific LSP client extensions. It also defines the data models for LSP diagnostics.

components.name: LSPClient
components.description: Establishes and maintains LSP connections, providing core communication primitives (_send_request, _wait_for_response, _send_notification) for sending requests and processing responses. Acts as the central hub for LSP interactions within the subsystem, delegating low‑level messaging and invoking analysis tasks.

components.name: TypeScriptClient
components.description: Extends the LSPClient to provide TypeScript‑specific functionalities, including initialization, workspace configuration, project bootstrapping, and dependency management tailored for TypeScript projects. Leverages the Analysis Orchestrator for filtering source files.

components.name: JavaClient
components.description: Extends the LSPClient to provide Java‑specific functionalities, such as JVM heap calculation, Java Development Tools Language Server (JDTLS) location, and project validation for Java projects. Relies on the base LSP communication provided by LSPClient.

components.name: Code Analyzer
components.description: Encapsulates the logic for translating high‑level analysis requests (e.g., document symbols, superclasses, definitions) into specific LSP calls and processing their structured responses. Leverages the LSPClient for communication.

components.name: LSP Message Handler
components.description: Manages the low‑level aspects of LSP messaging, including reading incoming messages, dispatching notifications, and processing diagnostic notifications received from the LSP server. Supplies messages to LSPClient and populates the Diagnostic Data Model.

components.name: Diagnostic Data Model
components.description: Defines the data structures (DiagnosticPosition, DiagnosticRange, LSPDiagnostic, FileDiagnosticsMap) used to represent and organize diagnostic information received from the LSP server, making it consumable by other parts of the system.

components.name: Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Coordinates the overall static analysis pipeline. It identifies source files, prepares the analysis environment, filters relevant files, and triggers the build of static analysis data. Interacts with LSPClient for environment setup and with Code Analyzer to run specific analysis routines.

components.name: Project Configuration Scanner
components.description: Locates and parses language‑specific build and configuration files (e.g., pom.xml, tsconfig.json) to extract module structure, dependencies, and build settings. This information is vital for correctly bootstrapping LSP servers and understanding project layout.

components.name: Java Project Scanner
components.description: Orchestrates discovery of Java projects within a directory, identifying Maven, Gradle, and Eclipse projects and initiating their configuration analysis. Acts as the entry point for scanning Java codebases.

components.name: Java Project Configuration Handler
components.description: Parses Java build files (pom.xml, build.gradle) to extract detailed build settings, dependencies, and module structure, representing this information in a structured format.

components.name: TypeScript Project Scanner
components.description: Identifies and scans TypeScript projects by locating tsconfig.json files, defining project boundaries and initiating extraction of TypeScript-specific configuration details.

components.name: Java Environment Utility
components.description: Provides utilities for detecting, managing, and configuring the Java development environment, including locating installations, determining versions, and setting up LSP tools like JDTLS.

components.name: Analysis Results Store
components.description: Stores, retrieves, and caches all outputs of the static analysis, including CFGs, class hierarchies, package dependencies, and diagnostics. It provides efficient access for downstream components and ensures persistence of large volumes of analysis data.

components.name: StaticAnalysisResults Manager
components.description: Primary component for aggregating, managing, and providing access to all static analysis outputs. Acts as the central orchestrator for different types of analysis results, including CFGs, package dependencies, code references, class hierarchies, and source file metadata.

components.name: Analysis Cache
components.description: Dedicated caching layer for static analysis results, optimizing performance by storing and retrieving previously computed data. Persists analysis results, retrieves cached data, and manages cache entries.

components.name: Source File Manager
components.description: Handles storage and retrieval of source file contents associated with an analysis, isolating raw code management from other analysis artifacts.

components.name: Code Graph & Clustering Engine
components.description: Builds graph representations of the codebase, such as call graphs, and applies clustering algorithms to group related elements into logical components. This transforms low‑level analysis data into higher‑level architectural views.

components.name: Code Graph Data Structures
components.description: Defines the foundational data structures, `Node` and `Edge`, which represent entities and relationships within the codebase graph. Includes methods for managing node properties (e.g., `is_callable`, `entity_label`) and creating graph edges (`add_edge`).

components.name: Call Graph Builder
components.description: Responsible for constructing and managing the `CallGraph` instance. Provides functionalities to add nodes (`add_node`), filter graph elements by files (`filter_by_files`), and perform internal graph balancing operations (`_balance_clusters`, `_merge_small_clusters`, `_split_large_cluster`).

components.name: Clustering Algorithms
components.description: Encapsulates the core logic for adaptive graph clustering, including methods like `_adaptive_clustering`, `_cluster_at_level`, `_cluster_with_algorithm`, utilities for creating abstracted graphs (`_create_abstracted_graph`), and mechanisms for evaluating clustering quality (`_is_good_clustering`).

components.name: Clustering Result Manager
components.description: Manages the storage and retrieval of clustering outcomes through the `ClusterResult` class. Offers methods to access cluster identifiers (`get_cluster_ids`), files associated with clusters (`get_clusters_for_file`), and nodes within specific clusters (`get_nodes_for_cluster`).

components.name: Clustering Orchestrator
components.description: Serves as the primary interface for initiating the clustering process. Coordinates the Call Graph Builder, Clustering Algorithms, and Clustering Result Manager to execute clustering and provide formatted string representations of the results (`cluster`, `to_cluster_string`).

components.name: Cluster Utilities
components.description: Provides helper functions for post-processing and aggregating cluster results. Utilities assist in constructing comprehensive cluster reports and handling language‑specific considerations (e.g., `build_all_cluster_results`, `build_cluster_results_for_languages`).

components.name: Language Definition & Discovery
components.description: Defines metadata and settings for each supported programming language (e.g., file extensions, LSP server commands) and performs initial repository scanning to discover source files, identify programming languages present, and collect basic statistics.

components.name: Language Definition Store
components.description: Authoritative source for static metadata and configuration of supported programming languages, providing lookup for file extensions, keywords, comment syntax, and related LSP commands.

components.name: Programming Language Factory
components.description: Creates and manages instances of ProgrammingLanguage objects by retrieving static configurations from the Language Definition Store and constructing runtime-ready language objects.

components.name: Repository File Scanner
components.description: Traverses a project repository, identifies source files using language definitions, determines each file's programming language, and gathers basic statistics such as paths and sizes.

components.name: Code Reference Resolver
components.description: Resolves fully qualified code references to concrete file paths and line numbers. This ensures that every extracted code element can be accurately linked back to its source location, enabling precise navigation and context for downstream processing.

components.name: Reference Resolver Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central coordinator for the reference‑resolution workflow. It initializes the process, manages relative‑path handling, delegates matching and path‑resolution tasks, and cleans up any unresolved references.

components.name: Reference Matching Engine
components.description: Implements the matching logic for individual code references, offering exact and loose matching strategies to locate a direct correspondence between a reference and an existing code element.

components.name: Reference Path Resolver
components.description: Handles the physical mapping of references by interpreting file‑system paths and qualified names, providing utilities to check file existence and to convert qualified names into possible file locations.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: This component represents the core intelligence of the CodeBoarding tool, leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to interpret and summarize codebase information. It handles prompt generation tailored for various LLM providers, orchestrates the LLM's workflow, and structures the AI-generated insights into consistent data models.

components.name: AI Workflow Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central control unit for the AI Interpretation Layer, managing the overall flow of AI‑driven analysis, coordinating specialized AI agents, handling their execution, and integrating their outputs into a coherent analysis.

components.name: AI Workflow Orchestrator (Core)
components.description: Primary control unit for AI-driven analysis, embodied by agents.agent.CodeBoardingAgent. Manages overall workflow, coordinates specialized agents, handles execution lifecycle, integrates outputs, monitors performance, and resolves inter-agent references.

components.name: Agent Task Dispatcher
components.description: Dynamically selects and assigns appropriate Specialized AI Agents to specific analysis steps, ensuring efficient utilization and proper task routing. This component is crucial for implementing the "Pipeline/Workflow pattern" by directing tasks to the correct processing units.

components.name: Result Aggregator & Synthesizer
components.description: Collects, merges, and synthesizes outputs from Specialized AI Agents into a unified, structured interpretation, leveraging ReferenceResolverMixin capabilities. This component is vital for the "AI Interpretation Layer" to produce coherent and actionable insights from potentially fragmented agent outputs.

components.name: Monitoring & Reporting Module
components.description: Provides observability into AI workflow execution and agent performance, collecting metrics, tracking status, and reporting health and progress via MonitoringMixin capabilities. This component is essential for maintaining the reliability and performance of the AI-driven analysis, aligning with best practices for complex systems.

components.name: Specialized AI Agents
components.description: Modular, typically stateless agents that perform focused analysis tasks such as code summarization, pattern identification, or vulnerability detection. These agents embody the core "AI-driven processing pattern" and are the workhorses of the "AI Interpretation Layer".

components_relations.relation: consumes operational data and alerts from
sends status updates and metrics to

components.name: Prompt & LLM Configuration Manager
components.description: Generates prompts tailored for diverse LLM providers and manages configuration, initialization, and selection of these providers, abstracting prompt engineering and LLM‑specific interactions.

components.name: Prompt Factory Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central hub for prompt management. Initializes the global prompt factory, registers all LLM-specific prompt providers, and offers a unified interface for retrieving prompts tailored to a specific LLM type. This component is critical for the AI-driven processing pattern, enabling flexible interaction with various LLMs.

components.name: LLM Configuration Manager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle, API keys, model arguments, and activation status for all supported LLMs, ensuring they are correctly configured, authenticated, and available for prompt generation. This component underpins the extensibility of the system by allowing easy integration and management of new LLM providers.

components.name: GPT Prompt Provider
components.description: Supplies prompt templates and messages specifically designed for OpenAI's GPT models, ensuring optimal interaction and performance. This component exemplifies the modularity required for supporting diverse LLM APIs within the AI-driven processing pattern.

components.name: Claude Prompt Provider
components.description: Provides prompt templates and messages tailored for Anthropic's Claude models, adapting prompt engineering strategies to Claude's characteristics.

components.name: DeepSeek Prompt Provider
components.description: Delivers prompt templates and messages optimized for DeepSeek models, ensuring effective communication and response generation.

components.name: Gemini Flash Prompt Provider
components.description: Offers prompt templates specifically for the Gemini Flash LLM, facilitating efficient and accurate interactions with Google's Gemini models.

components.name: GLM Prompt Provider
components.description: Supplies prompt templates and messages customized for GLM models, ensuring compatibility and performance.

components.name: Kimi Prompt Provider
components.description: Provides prompt templates and messages specifically for Kimi models, enabling tailored interactions.

components.name: Analysis Data Model
components.description: Defines structured data formats for inputs, intermediate states, and final AI‑generated insights, ensuring consistency and providing a standardized schema for representing components, file classifications, relationships, and other analysis results.

components.name: Analysis Data Models
components.description: Defines the foundational data structures and schemas for all analysis-related information, providing canonical representations for various insights and identified software components, ensuring data consistency and serving as the standardized output format for all analysis agents.

components.name: Analysis Result Processor
components.description: Processes, manages, and transforms the structured analysis data defined by the Analysis Data Models, handling file classification, CFG components, cluster analysis, and updating the overall analysis state, including utilities for LLM consumption.

components.name: LLM Interface
components.description: Provides a standardized abstraction layer for interacting with Large Language Models, defining base models and utilities to facilitate consistent input preparation and structured extraction of insights.

components.name: Source Code Context Manager
components.description: Manages and provides references to specific parts of the source code, ensuring analysis results and insights can be accurately linked back to their original location, enhancing traceability and user understanding.

components.name: Detailed Analysis Agent
components.description: Specialized AI agent focused on performing in‑depth analysis of specific code components or clusters, extracting granular details and fine‑grained insights for a comprehensive low‑level understanding of the codebase.

components.name: Details Agent
components.description: Specialized AI agent focused on performing in‑depth analysis of specific code components or clusters, extracting granular details and fine‑grained insights for a comprehensive low‑level understanding of the codebase. It orchestrates the overall analysis workflow, leveraging clustering and AI interpretation.

components.name: Agent Base
components.description: An abstract base class (CodeBoardingAgent) that establishes the common interface and foundational behaviors for all analysis agents within the system. It ensures consistent initialization, execution, and result handling across different agent implementations.

components.name: Clustering Utilities
components.description: A mixin (ClusterMethodsMixin) providing reusable utility methods for organizing code entities into logical clusters. This includes functionalities like assigning files to components, building cluster strings, and creating component subgraphs. It acts as an interface to the Static Analysis Engine.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: The underlying engine responsible for performing low-level code parsing, Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) generation, and dependency analysis. It identifies structural relationships within the codebase and provides the raw, structured data necessary for clustering and subsequent AI interpretation.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: Applies AI/ML models, specifically Large Language Models (LLMs), to the structured output from static analysis and clustering. Its primary role is to generate high-level insights, summaries, and documentation by abstracting complex code details into human-readable or machine-consumable forms.

components.name: Abstraction Agent
components.description: Specialized AI agent responsible for generating high‑level summaries and architectural abstractions from detailed analysis results, distilling complex code structures into understandable component definitions and relationships.

components.name: Abstraction Agent Orchestrator
components.description: Serves as the primary controller for the entire abstraction and summarization process, managing the lifecycle and state of the abstraction workflow.

components.name: Abstraction Workflow Initiator
components.description: Provides the public entry point for triggering the abstraction workflow, acting as the API service for external systems.

components.name: Code Grouping Processor
components.description: Identifies and groups related code components based on detailed analysis results, performing iterative processing to refine logical clusters.

components.name: Abstraction Summarization Engine
components.description: Synthesizes grouped code components into a high-level abstract representation or summary, generating insights and final output.

components.name: Metadata Analysis Agent
components.description: Specialized AI agent that extracts and interprets project‑level metadata such as project type, domain, and technology stack, providing initial context that guides downstream interpretation steps.

components.name: MetaAgent Orchestrator
components.description: Entry point and primary control mechanism for metadata analysis; initiates high‑level analysis, sets direction, manages project context, and delegates detailed extraction to the Project Metadata Analyzer.

components.name: Project Metadata Analyzer
components.description: Core component that extracts, processes, and interprets project‑level metadata, identifying type, domain, and technology stack, with capability for iterative refinement.

components.name: Analysis Planner
components.description: Intelligent component that determines strategic next steps in the AI analysis workflow, deciding which components or areas of the codebase require further expansion, detailed examination, or abstraction based on current analysis state and predefined criteria.

components.name: Analysis Planner
components.description: Intelligent component that determines strategic next steps in the AI analysis workflow, deciding which components or areas of the codebase require further expansion, detailed examination, or abstraction based on current analysis state and predefined criteria.

components.name: API Service
components.description: Provides the external interface for users or other systems to initiate analysis requests and monitor their progress.

components.name: Job Database/Scheduler
components.description: Manages the queue of analysis jobs, their status, and scheduling, ensuring persistence and orderly processing.

components.name: Code Retrieval Engine
components.description: Responsible for securely fetching and preparing source code from various specified repositories for analysis.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Performs detailed static code analysis, extracting structural, semantic, and dependency information from the codebase.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: Processes the output from the Static Analysis Engine, applying AI/ML models to interpret findings, identify patterns, and generate high-level insights and abstractions.

components.name: Output Generation Engine
components.description: Formats and renders the interpreted analysis results into various human-readable outputs, such as diagrams (Mermaid.js), textual summaries, or reports.

components.name: AI Insight Validation Engine
components.description: Ensures quality, correctness, and consistency of AI‑generated analysis results by validating file classifications, component relationships, and cluster coverage against predefined rules or heuristics, providing feedback for refinement.

components.name: Validation Result Manager
components.description: Defines and manages the standardized `ValidationResult` data structure used to encapsulate outcomes of all validation checks. It provides a consistent interface for reporting validation statuses, errors, and warnings across the subsystem.

components.name: Core Analysis Data Validator
components.description: Performs fundamental checks on the completeness and structural correctness of the raw or partially processed codebase analysis data, including verifying cluster coverage, ensuring unique identifiers are populated, and validating the integrity of key entities.

components.name: Component Relationship Validator
components.description: Analyzes and validates structural and interaction relationships between identified components or clusters within the codebase. It builds internal lookup structures and checks for valid connections or dependencies.

components.name: File Classification & Path Validator
components.description: Ensures consistency of file paths and validates the classification of files within the project's directory structure. Includes utility functions for path normalization to maintain uniformity.

components.name: AI Tooling & Data Access Layer
components.description: This component provides a set of specialized tools and APIs that the AI Interpretation Layer (specifically the LLM agents) can invoke to gather specific information about the codebase. It acts as the programmatic interface for the AI to interact with the underlying analysis data, allowing it to query for CFGs, file structures, code snippets, and package relations.

components.name: CodeBoardingToolkit
components.description: Central orchestrator and façade that instantiates and exposes specialized analysis tools, providing a unified entry point for AI agents to interact with codebase analysis data.

components.name: CodeBoardingToolkit
components.description: Central orchestrator and façade that instantiates, configures, and exposes a collection of specialized analysis tools to AI agents, acting as the single entry point for analysis requests.

components.name: Static Analysis Tool
components.description: Specialized tool that performs static code analysis, such as parsing, dependency mapping, and identifying code smells. Integrated and delegated to by the CodeBoardingToolkit.

components.name: Repository Manager Tool
components.description: Specialized tool responsible for interacting with code repositories, handling cloning, fetching branches/commits, and managing local codebases for analysis.

components.name: AI Interpretation Tool
components.description: Specialized tool that applies AI/ML models to raw analysis data to generate higher-level insights, summaries, or documentation, receiving data from the CodeBoardingToolkit.

components.name: Output Generation Tool
components.description: Specialized tool that transforms interpreted data into various output formats such as diagrams, reports, or structured documentation, finalizing the output for AI agents or end-users.

components.name: BaseRepoTool
components.description: Foundational component offering repository utilities such as file caching, .gitignore handling, and common repository interaction methods, serving as the base class for other analysis tools.

components.name: Repository Manager Subsystem
components.description: The overarching component responsible for managing all aspects of code repository interaction. It acts as a facade, abstracting the complexities of repository operations and ensuring controlled access to source code for analysis.

components.name: BaseRepoTool
components.description: Foundational component offering repository utilities such as file caching, .gitignore handling, and common repository interaction methods, serving as the base class for other analysis tools.

components.name: Concrete Repository Tools
components.description: Specialized classes that extend BaseRepoTool to implement specific repository operations, such as cloning a repository from a URL, reading specific files, or listing directory contents. These tools perform the actual data retrieval.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Manages the overall workflow of codebase analysis, coordinating the execution of various stages, including initiating repository operations and subsequent analysis steps.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Processes the retrieved source code to extract structural, semantic, and dependency information, preparing it for further interpretation by AI or other components.

components.name: GetCFGTool
components.description: Specialized tool that extracts and provides Control Flow Graph (CFG) data for specific code elements, enabling AI agents to understand execution flow and logical structure.

components.name: CFG Tool Interface (GetCFGTool)
components.description: Public entry point for AI agents to request CFG extraction; inherits from BaseRepoTool and orchestrates the process via its _run method, handling input parsing and output preparation.

components.name: CFG Generation Core (component_cfg)
components.description: Engine that performs static analysis to generate or retrieve the Control Flow Graph for a given code element, constituting the heavy‑lifting computation of the subsystem.

components.name: Repository Access Utilities
components.description: Auxiliary helpers that abstract interactions with the code repository, fetching source files required for CFG analysis and supporting the core generation logic.

components.name: ReadFileTool
components.description: Tool designed to read and retrieve specific content from files within the codebase, granting AI agents access to raw code snippets and other file-based information.

components.name: ReadFileTool
components.description: Provides direct, low-level access to file content from the filesystem. It handles reading files given a path and includes a caching mechanism to optimize repeated accesses, acting as the foundational layer for raw file data acquisition.

components.name: CodeReferenceReader
components.description: Acts as an abstraction layer for code retrieval. It interprets logical code references (e.g., fully qualified import paths), maps them to physical file paths, and orchestrates the process of fetching the corresponding source code.

components.name: FileStructureTool
components.description: Tool that provides information about the project's directory and file structure, helping AI agents understand overall organization and hierarchical relationships.

components.name: FileStructureTool
components.description: Primary interface for AI agents to query and understand the project's directory and file structure, abstracting filesystem traversal and providing an organized view of the codebase layout.

components.name: CodeStructureTool
components.description: Extracts and presents internal structural elements of the code (classes, functions, methods, relationships), providing a deeper semantic understanding of the codebase's logic.

components.name: DirectoryTreeGenerator
components.description: Utility that recursively traverses directories and files, constructing a hierarchical tree‑like string representation of the filesystem; serves as the engine for FileStructureTool.

components_relations.relation: delegates requests for CFG data to
delegates requests for file content to
delegates requests for file structure to

components.name: Analysis Optimization & Caching
components.description: This component is dedicated to optimizing the analysis process by detecting changes in the codebase, intelligently caching previous analysis results, and performing incremental updates. It leverages Git for change detection and manages the persistence and retrieval of static analysis data to minimize redundant computations.

components.name: Analysis Optimization & Caching
components.description: This component is dedicated to optimizing the analysis process by detecting changes in the codebase, intelligently caching previous analysis results, and performing incremental updates. It leverages Git for change detection and manages the persistence and retrieval of static analysis data to minimize redundant computations.

components.name: Change Detection Engine
components.description: Identifies modifications within the codebase by orchestrating Git diff operations, processing raw Git output, and structuring this information into a ChangeSet for downstream analysis.

components.name: Analysis Cache Manager
components.description: Manages storage, retrieval, and merging of static analysis results, ensuring previously computed data can be efficiently accessed and updated to minimize redundant computations.

components.name: Cluster Change Analyzer
components.description: Analyzes the impact of detected code changes on predefined structural clusters, classifying change types and calculating architectural evolution metrics, while interacting with cached analysis data for incremental processing.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the central control unit for the incremental analysis process. Determines whether a full or incremental analysis is required, coordinates execution of analysis steps, and merges results. It integrates cache access and change detection to optimize the workflow.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Orchestrator
components.description: Central control unit that decides analysis type, coordinates execution, and initiates cluster ID remapping for incremental updates.

components.name: Full Analysis Executor
components.description: Executes a complete re‑analysis of the entire codebase when incremental analysis is not feasible or a full scan is requested.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Runner
components.description: Runs analysis only on changed or newly added parts of the codebase, avoiding a full re‑scan for performance gains.

components.name: Cluster Result Calculator
components.description: Computes and finalizes detailed analysis results for identified clusters, processing raw outputs from either executor into structured results.

components.name: Incremental Update Processor
components.description: Integrates new or updated cluster results with existing analysis data, handling matching, merging, and finalizing the incremental update.

components.name: Incremental Diagram Updater
components.description: Orchestrates the incremental refresh of architectural diagrams. It consumes file changes, queries the manifest, runs impact analysis, and triggers re‑expansion or path‑patching as needed. It acts as a diagram‑specific orchestration engine.

components.name: Incremental Diagram Updater (Orchestrator)
components.description: Primary control component that receives file change notifications, decides if an incremental update is feasible, runs impact analysis, and coordinates update execution to refresh architectural diagrams.

components.name: Component Impact Calculator
components.description: Analyzes the impact of file changes on existing diagram components, identifying which components are dirty and need recomputation or updating.

components.name: Update Execution Handler
components.description: Executes modifications to the diagram's data structures, performing path patching and triggering recomputation of affected components as directed by the orchestrator.

components.name: File Path Utility
components.description: Provides functions for detecting file deletions, resolving renamed paths, and applying patches to analysis data structures to reflect file system changes accurately.

components.name: Analysis Manifest Manager
components.description: Stores the mapping between source files and architectural components and tracks which components are expanded. It serves as the metadata store that the updater and file manager consult to keep the manifest in sync with the codebase.

components.name: Incremental File Manager
components.description: Handles assignment of newly added files to existing components and removal of deleted files from the manifest during an incremental run. It provides the file‑system interaction needed for dynamic model evolution.

components.name: File Change Detection & Classification
components.description: Monitors the file system for newly added or modified files, classifies their type and purpose, and identifies files that need processing for incremental updates.

components.name: File Manifest Management
components.description: Maintains the authoritative manifest of all project files and their assignments to components, handling additions and deletions to keep the component‑to‑file mapping up‑to‑date.

components.name: Component Cluster Update Engine
components.description: Orchestrates re‑evaluation and generation of updated component cluster results based on file changes, ensuring logical grouping of files into components stays accurate.

components.name: Impact Analyzer
components.description: Evaluates the architectural impact of file changes, detecting cross‑component dependencies and deciding whether a change requires re‑analysis of related components or a broader update.

components.name: ImpactAnalyzer
components.description: Primary class that orchestrates the impact analysis workflow, receiving change notifications, coordinating dependency detection and impact evaluation, and aggregating results into a final impact report.

components.name: DependencyDetector
components.description: Functional unit (detect_dependencies) that parses changed files, builds or queries a dependency graph, and identifies all direct and indirect code dependencies affected by the changes.

components.name: ImpactEvaluator
components.description: Functional unit (evaluate_impact) that analyzes the detected dependency graph, applies heuristics to quantify architectural impact, and determines the re‑analysis scope required.

components.name: Component Re-expansion & Scoped Analysis
components.description: Executes targeted deeper re‑analysis for specific components or sub‑graphs when changes are too significant for simple patching, ensuring accurate updates. This isolates processing to affected areas, following a micro‑service‑like analysis pattern.

components.name: Scoped Analysis Engine
components.description: Acts as the primary orchestrator for incremental analysis, handling scoped updates and impact analysis. It detects changes within specific components, initiates incremental analysis, and assesses whether deeper re-analysis is required.

components.name: Component Re-expansion Engine
components.description: Executes deeper, more extensive re-analysis for components or sub-graphs when changes are too significant for simple patching, expanding the scope of analysis beyond initial incremental boundaries.

components.name: Incremental Data Models & Utilities
components.description: Provides shared data structures, I/O helpers, validation logic, component checks, path manipulation, JSON serialization, and version information used across the entire incremental subsystem.

components.name: Incremental Data Models & Utilities
components.description: Provides foundational shared data structures, I/O helpers, change detection logic, path manipulation, and JSON serialization mechanisms essential for the entire incremental subsystem, centralizing core functionalities that would otherwise be duplicated across various incremental analysis stages.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Validation Service
components.description: Responsible for ensuring the integrity and consistency of incremental analysis results and detected changes by applying a set of validation rules to maintain reliability and correctness of the analysis output.

components.name: System Metadata Service
components.description: Provides core versioning and metadata information for the CodeBoarding tool, enabling traceability in generated outputs and helping understand the context and origin of analysis results.

components_relations.relation: provides data models and detected changes to

components.name: Monitoring & Observability
components.description: This component is responsible for observing the system's operational health, tracking LLM usage, and performing code quality checks. It provides insights into both the performance of the analysis tool and the quality of the analyzed codebase, collecting and persisting metrics for later analysis and reporting.

components.name: MonitoringDataCollector
components.description: Captures real-time operational metrics and events from instrumented code, acting as the primary entry point for raw monitoring data.

components.name: MonitoringDataCollector
components.description: Captures real-time operational metrics and events from instrumented code, acting as the primary entry point for raw monitoring data.

components.name: API Service
components.description: Provides external interfaces for users and other systems to interact with the codebase analysis tool, initiating analysis jobs and retrieving results.

components.name: Job Database
components.description: Stores information about analysis jobs, their status, configurations, and potentially raw monitoring data or intermediate results.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of analysis jobs, coordinating the execution of various stages (retrieval, analysis, AI interpretation, output generation) and handling workflow transitions.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Handles interactions with code repositories (e.g., Git, SVN), responsible for cloning, fetching, and managing codebase versions for analysis.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Performs static code analysis on retrieved codebases, identifying patterns, dependencies, and potential issues without executing the code.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: Utilizes Large Language Models (LLMs) to interpret static analysis results, summarize code, identify architectural patterns, and generate high-level insights.

components.name: Output Generation Engine
components.description: Transforms interpreted data and architectural insights into various output formats, such as diagrams (Mermaid.js), textual summaries, or documentation.

components.name: MonitoringStatsAggregator
components.description: Processes and accumulates raw metrics into meaningful runtime statistics, such as token usage, tool invocation counts, and latencies.

components.name: MonitoringStatsAggregator
components.description: The primary interface and orchestrator for the monitoring.stats subsystem, providing methods for other parts of the system to record metrics and retrieve aggregated statistics, delegating data management to RunStatsManager and lifecycle operations to StatsLifecycleHandler.

components.name: RunStatsManager
components.description: The core data repository for all runtime statistics, holding, updating, and serializing metrics such as token usage, tool invocation counts, and latencies collected during the analysis process.

components.name: StatsLifecycleHandler
components.description: Manages the initialization and resetting of statistical data structures within the monitoring.stats subsystem, ensuring a clean default state at the start of a new analysis run or when a reset is required.

components.name: MonitoringDataWriter
components.description: Responsible for persisting aggregated monitoring statistics and metadata to external storage for long-term analysis and reporting.

components.name: StatsWriter Orchestrator
components.description: Acts as the primary coordinator for all monitoring and statistics writing activities. It manages the lifecycle from initialization to the start of the streaming process, delegating tasks to other components within the subsystem.

components.name: Monitoring Lifecycle Manager
components.description: Handles the graceful termination of the monitoring system. Its responsibilities include ensuring proper resource deallocation and persisting high-level contextual information and summary data about each analysis run.

components.name: LLM Usage Data Collector
components.description: Gathers, aggregates, and persists metrics specifically related to Large Language Model (LLM) interactions, such as token usage. This ensures that LLM resource consumption is accurately tracked and recorded.

components.name: Real-time Stream Processor
components.description: Continuously processes and streams real-time monitoring data, with a particular focus on token usage, during an active analysis session. It provides raw data that can be used for aggregation by other components.

components.name: MonitoringExecutionContext
components.description: Manages the lifecycle and scope of monitoring activities, enabling or disabling data collection based on execution context.

components.name: MonitoringExecutionContext
components.description: Manages the lifecycle and scope of monitoring activities, enabling or disabling data collection based on execution context. It acts as the central control point for monitoring within a given operation.

components.name: MonitoringConfigManager
components.description: Centralized management and provision of monitoring configuration settings, including what to monitor, thresholds, and reporting destinations.

components.name: TelemetryCollector
components.description: An abstract or orchestrating component responsible for coordinating the collection of all types of telemetry data (metrics, traces, logs) from various sources within the application.

components.name: MetricEmitter
components.description: Specifically handles the collection and emission of numerical metrics (e.g., execution times, resource usage, counts) from different stages of the codebase analysis.

components.name: TraceSpanManager
components.description: Manages the creation, propagation, and completion of tracing spans to enable distributed tracing across the various steps of the analysis pipeline.

components.name: LogHandler
components.description: Processes and dispatches log records generated by the application, potentially enriching them with contextual information before forwarding.

components.name: MonitoringBackendAdapter
components.description: Provides an abstraction layer for sending collected telemetry data to different external monitoring systems (e.g., Prometheus, Jaeger, ELK stack).

components.name: HealthCheckService
components.description: Continuously monitors the operational status and availability of critical components within the system, reporting their health.

components.name: MonitoringIntegrationMixin
components.description: Offers a standardized, reusable mechanism for other system components to easily inject monitoring capabilities without boilerplate.

components.name: API Service
components.description: Provides the external interface for users and other systems to interact with the codebase analysis tool, handling request reception, authentication, and delivering analysis results.

components.name: Orchestration Engine
components.description: Manages the overall workflow of codebase analysis jobs, coordinating the execution sequence of various stages from code acquisition to output generation.

components.name: Job Database
components.description: A persistent store for all job‑related data, including analysis requests, configurations, intermediate processing states, and final results.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Handles the fetching, cloning, and management of source code repositories from various version control systems, providing the raw input for analysis.

components.name: Static Analysis Engine
components.description: Performs in‑depth static code analysis on the retrieved source code, identifying structural patterns, dependencies, and potential issues without executing the code.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: Utilizes AI/ML models, including Large Language Models (LLMs), to process static analysis outputs and other data, generating high‑level insights, summaries, and documentation.

components.name: Output Generation Engine
components.description: Formats and renders the AI‑interpreted results into various user‑friendly outputs, such as visual diagrams (e.g., Mermaid.js) and comprehensive textual reports.

components.name: MonitoringIntegrationMixin
components.description: Offers a standardized, reusable mechanism for other system components to easily inject monitoring capabilities (e.g., metrics, tracing, logging hooks) without boilerplate.
